core.h

00010  * WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00011  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
00012  * General Public License for more details.
00013  *
00014  * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
00015  * along with Xenomai; if not, write to the Free Software
00016  * Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place - Suite 330, Boston, MA
00017  * 02111-1307, USA.
00018  *
00019  * Core pod definitions. The core pod supports all APIs providing a
00020  * system call interface to user-space applications. Core APIs, namely
00021  * POSIX, native, RTDM and UVM, only use a sub-range of the available
00022  * priority levels of the core pod, in order to have them exhibit a
00023  * 1:1 mapping with Linux's SCHED_FIFO ascending priority
00024  * scale. Non-core APIs may also rely on the core pod, provided they
00025  * normalize the priority levels of their threads when calling the
00026  * nucleus, in order to match the priority scale enforced by the
00027  * former.
00028  */
00029 
00030 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_CORE_H
00031 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_CORE_H
00032 
00033 /* Visible priority range supported by the core pod. */
00034 #define XNCORE_MIN_PRIO     0
00035 #define XNCORE_MAX_PRIO     256
00036 
00037 /* Total number of priority levels (including the hidden root one) */
00038 #define XNCORE_NR_PRIO      (XNCORE_MAX_PRIO - XNCORE_MIN_PRIO + 2)
00039 
00040 /* Priority sub-range used by core APIs. */
00041 #define XNCORE_LOW_PRIO     0
00042 #define XNCORE_HIGH_PRIO    99
00043 
00044 /* Priority of IRQ servers in user-space. */
00045 #define XNCORE_IRQ_PRIO     XNCORE_MAX_PRIO
00046 
00047 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00048 
00049 #include <linux/config.h>
00050 
00051 #ifdef __cplusplus
00052 extern "C" {
00053 #endif /* __cplusplus */
00054 
00055 int xncore_mount(void);
00056 
00057 int xncore_umount(void);
00058 
00059 int xncore_attach(void);
00060 
00061 void xncore_detach(int xtype);
00062 
00063 #ifdef __cplusplus
00064 };
00065 #endif /* __cplusplus */
00066 
00067 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00068 
00069 #endif /* !_XENO_NUCLEUS_CORE_H */
